item.title: Tiffany add a quote by James Maguire
item.description: "You know you're a Puritan when you feel that even the Bible needs to be cleaned up." -- James Maguire

item.title: Tiffany add a quote by Geoff Nunberg
item.description: "["Emoticon" is] one of the worst words ever--it deserves to die horribly in a head-on crash with <i>infotainment</i>." -- Geoff Nunberg

item.title: Tiffany add a quote by James Maguire
item.description: "The big break from the past may come when speech recognition software is perfected. At that point we'll be able to write simply by talking: Speak into your computer's recorder, and it'll do all the messy work of punctuation and spelling. This could result in the elimination of the keyboard, [Dennis] Baron speculates. 'We'd get back to oral composition--reinventing Homer." -- James Maguire

item.title: Tiffany add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Tiffany add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Tiffany add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tiffany add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Tiffany add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Tiffany add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Tiffany add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Tiffany add a quote by Gordon A. Eadie
item.description: "If you don't stand for something you will fall for anything." -- Gordon A. Eadie

item.title: Tiffany add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Tiffany add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "This is not a novel to be tossed aside lightly. It should be thrown with great force." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Tiffany add a quote by Jay Asher
item.description: "You don’t know what goes on in anyone’s life but your own. And when you mess with one part of a person’s life, you’re not messing with just that part. Unfortunately, you can’t be that precise and selective. When you mess with one part of a person’s life, you’re messing with their entire life. Everything. . . affects everything." -- Jay Asher

item.title: Tiffany add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Tiffany add a quote by Barack Obama
item.description: "Our challenges may be new. The instruments with which we meet them may be new. But those values upon which our success depends - honesty and hard work, courage and fair play, tolerance and curiosity, loyalty and patriotism - these things are old. These things are true. They have been the quiet force of progress throughout our history. What is demanded then is a return to these truths. What is required of us now is a new era of responsibility - a recognition, on the part of every American, that we have duties to ourselves, our nation, and the world, duties that we do not grudgingly accept but rather seize gladly, firm in the knowledge that there is nothing so satisfying to the spirit, so defining of our character, than giving our all to a difficult task." -- Barack Obama

item.title: Tiffany add a quote by Barack Obama
item.description: "In the unlikely story that is America, there has never been anything false about hope." -- Barack Obama

item.title: Tiffany add a quote by Barack Obama
item.description: "We are the change we have been waiting for." -- Barack Obama

item.title: Tiffany add a quote by Barack Obama
item.description: "Change will not come if we wait for some other person, or if we wait for some other time. We are the ones we've been waiting for. We are the change that we seek." -- Barack Obama

item.title: Tiffany add a quote by Barack Obama
item.description: "The best way to not feel hopeless is to get up and do something. Don’t wait for good things to happen to you. If you go out and make some good things happen, you will fill the world with hope, you will fill yourself with hope." -- Barack Obama

item.title: Tiffany add a quote by Barack Obama
item.description: "A change is brought about because ordinary people do extraordinary things." -- Barack Obama

item.title: Tiffany add a quote by Barack Obama
item.description: "There's not a liberal America and a conservative America - there's the United States of America." -- Barack Obama

item.title: Tiffany add a quote by Barack Obama
item.description: "In the face of impossible odds, people who love this country can change it." -- Barack Obama

item.title: Tiffany add a quote by Barack Obama
item.description: "We don't ask you to believe in our ability to bring change, rather, we ask you to believe in yours." -- Barack Obama

item.title: Tiffany add a quote by Barack Obama
item.description: "Nothing can stand in the way of the power of millions of voices calling for change." -- Barack Obama

item.title: Tiffany add a quote by Barack Obama
item.description: "If you're walking down the right path and you're willing to keep walking, eventually you'll make progress." -- Barack Obama

item.title: Tiffany add a quote by Barack Obama
item.description: "If there's a child on the south side of Chicago who can't read, that matters to me, even if it's not my child. If there's a senior citizen somewhere who can't pay for their prescription, who has to choose between medicine and the rent, that makes my life poorer - even if it's not my grandparent. If there's an Arab-American or Mexican-American family being rounded up by John Ashcroft without benefit of an attorney or due process, I know that that threatens my civil liberties. And I don't have to be a woman to be concerned that the Supreme Court is trying to take away a woman's right, because I know that my rights are next. It is that fundamental belief - I am my brother’s keeper, I am my sister’s keeper - that makes this country work." -- Barack Obama

item.title: Tiffany add a quote by Barak Obama
item.description: "One voice can change a room, and if one voice can change a room, then it can change a city, and if it can change a city, it can change a state, and if it change a state, it can change a nation, and if it can change a nation, it can change the world. Your voice can change the world." -- Barak Obama

item.title: Tiffany add a quote by Barack Obama
item.description: "I believe in evolution, scientific inquiry, and global warming; I believe in free speech, whether politically correct or politically incorrect, and I am suspicious of using government to impose anybody's religious beliefs -including my own- on nonbelievers." -- Barack Obama

item.title: Tiffany add a quote by Barack Obama
item.description: "To the Muslim world, we seek a new way forward, based on mutual interest and mutual respect. To those leaders around the globe who seek to sow conflict, or blame their society's ills on the West - know that your people will judge you on what you can build, not what you destroy. To those who cling to power through corruption and deceit and the silencing of dissent, know that you are on the wrong side of history; but that we will extend a hand if you are willing to unclench your fist." -- Barack Obama
